children.name: State PILT Profiles
children.definition: Payments in Lieu of Taxes annual funding.

children.name: State PILT Amount
children.definition: Payments in Lieu of Taxes annual funding aggregated at the state level.

children.name: State PILT Entitlement Land
children.definition: The area of Federal Lands in a county eligible for PILT funding (in acres) aggregated at the state level.

children.name: State Percent PILT Acres
children.definition: The percentage of the county's total land area that consists of land eligible for PILT funding aggregated at the state level.

children.name: State PILT per Acre
children.definition: The Payments in Lieu of Taxes annual funding per acre of entitlement land aggregated at the state level.

children.name: PILT Profiles
children.definition: Payments in Lieu of Taxes annual funding

children.name: PILT Amount
children.definition: Payments in Lieu of Taxes (PILT) funding to county governments based on presence of certain federal lands within their boundaries.

children.name: PILT Annual Growth Rate
children.definition: Percent change in Payments in Lieu of Taxes annual funding from the previous year

children.name: Total PILT Entitlement Land
children.definition: The area of Federal Lands in a county eligible for PILT funding (in acres).

children.name: Percent of PILT Entitlement Land
children.definition: The percentage of the county's total land area that consists of land eligible for PILT funding.

children.name: PILT per Acre
children.definition: The Payments in Lieu of Taxes annual funding per acre of entitlement land.

children.name: Total SRS & PILT Impact
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Department of the Interior and the U.S. Forest Service
children.definition: Total projected change in PILT FY 2015 and SRS FY 2014 funding for a county, if SRS FY 2014 had not been reauthorized and PILT payments were adjusted accordingly.

children.name: State Total SRS & PILT Impact
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Department of the Interior and the U.S. Forest Service
children.definition: State aggregate projected changes in PILT FY 2015 and SRS FY 2014 funding, if SRS FY 2014 had not been reauthorized and PILT payments were adjusted accordingly.

children.name: SRS Impact
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Department of the Interior and the U.S. Forest Service
children.definition: Projected changes in federal payments by replacing FY 2014 Secure Rural Schools program with permanently authorized FY 2014 25% Fund Payments. If the Secure Rural Schools program is not reauthorized forest payments to counties revert to the 25% Fund Payment (16 U.S.C. 500).

children.name: PILT Impact
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Department of the Interior and the U.S. Forest Service
children.definition: Projected changes in Payment in Lieu of Taxes (PILT) FY 2015 formula payments to counties, if SRS FY 2014 had not been reauthorized.  Calculations based on $442 million in appropriated funds for FY 2015.

children.name: State SRS Impact
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Department of the Interior and the U.S. Forest Service
children.definition: Projected changes in federal payments by replacing FY 2014 Secure Rural Schools program with permanently authorized FY 2014 25% Fund Payments aggregated at the state-level. If the Secure Rural Schools program is not reauthorized forest payments to counties revert to the 25% Fund Payment (16 U.S.C. 500).

children.name: State PILT Impact
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Department of the Interior and the U.S. Forest Service
children.definition: Projected changes in Payment in Lieu of Taxes (PILT) FY 2015 formula payments aggregated at the state-level, if SRS FY 2014 had not been reauthorized.  Calculations based on $442 million in appropriated funds for FY 2015.

children.name: SRS Profiles
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Forest Service data and Bureau of Land Management and Headwaters Economics analysis of U.S. Geological Survey, Protected Areas Database
children.definition: Profiles showing that without the SRS Act reauthorization, states revert to the Payments to States Act of 1908 as amended, receiving a 25 percent payment from national forest receipts. USFS estimates FY 2015 county 25 percent payments based on county shares of the national forest receipts. These estimates do not reflect the application of a 6.8 percent sequester to the state payments. Note: The receipts year reflects when U.S. Forest Service (USFS) collects revenues from national forest lands.

children.name: SRS Amount
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Forest Service data and Bureau of Land Management and Headwaters Economics analysis of U.S. Geological Survey, Protected Areas Database
children.definition: Funding received by counties through the Secure Rural Schools program based on  forest receipts, FY 2015 receipts year.

children.name: Projected 25% Payment
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Forest Service data and Bureau of Land Management and Headwaters Economics analysis of U.S. Geological Survey, Protected Areas Database
children.definition: Without the SRS Act reauthorization, states would have reverted  to the Payments to States Act of 1908 as amended, receiving a 25  percent payment from the national forest receipts. U.S.F.S.  estimated  FY 2015 25 percent payments based on county shares of the  national forest receipts.  These estimates did not reflect the application  of a 6.8 percent sequester to the payments to the states.

children.name: Payment Percent Change
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Forest Service data and Bureau of Land Management and Headwaters Economics analysis of U.S. Geological Survey, Protected Areas Database
children.definition: Percentage change in funding from the Secure Rural Schools  program in FY 2015 to the projected 25% Fund Payment in FY 2015.

children.name: State SRS Profiles
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Forest Service data and Bureau of Land Management and Headwaters Economics analysis of U.S. Geological Survey, Protected Areas Database
children.definition: Profiles of aggregated county payments at the state-level showing that without the SRS Act reauthorization, states revert to the Payments to States Act of 1908 as amended, receiving a 25 percent payment from national forest receipts. USFS estimates FY 2015 county 25 percent payments based on county shares of the national forest receipts. These estimates do not reflect the application of a 6.8 percent sequester to the state payments. Note: The receipts year reflects when U.S. Forest Service (USFS) collects revenues from national forest lands.

children.name: State SRS Amount
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Forest Service data and Bureau of Land Management and Headwaters Economics analysis of U.S. Geological Survey, Protected Areas Database
children.definition: Funding received by counties through the Secure Rural Schools program based on forest receipts, FY 2015 receipts year aggregated at the state-level.

children.name: State Projected 25% Payment
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Forest Service data and Bureau of Land Management and Headwaters Economics analysis of U.S. Geological Survey, Protected Areas Database
children.definition: Without the SRS Act reauthorization, states would have reverted to the Payments to States Act of 1908 as amended, receiving a 25 percent payment from the national forest receipts. U.S.F.S. estimated FY 2015 25 percent payments based on county shares of the national forest receipts. These estimates are aggregated at the state-level. These estimates did not reflect the application of a 6.8 percent sequester to the payments to the states.

children.name: State Payment Percent Change
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Forest Service data and Bureau of Land Management and Headwaters Economics analysis of U.S. Geological Survey, Protected Areas Database
children.definition: Percentage change in funding from the Secure Rural Schools program in FY 2015 aggregated at the state-level to the projected 25% Fund Payment in FY 2015 aggregated at the state-level.

children.name: Second Chance Act (SCA) Awards
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Department of Justice, Office of Justice Programs, Bureau of Justice Assistance and Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency data

children.name: SCA Total
children.definition: Total amount of SCA grant money awarded to any of the following within a county: unit(s) of county government, unit(s) of city government and/or nonprofit organization(s). SCA total does not include grant money awarded to state governments or any funds to counties, cities or nonprofits that pass through state government.

children.name: County Total
children.definition: Total amount of SCA grant money awarded to any unit(s) of county government.

children.name: City Total
children.definition: Total amount of SCA grant money awarded to any unit(s) of city government.

children.name: Nonprofit Total
children.definition: Total amount of SCA grant money awarded to any nonprofit organization(s) providing services to residents of the county, including county jail inmates and state prison inmates who are returned to the county.

children.name: Secure Rural Schools (SRS)
children.source: NACo Analysis of data from the U.S. Forest Service data and Bureau of Land Management and Headwaters Economics analysis of U.S. Geological Survey, Protected Areas Database

children.name: SCAAP Amount
children.definition: Funding received by a county from the State Criminal Alien Assistance Program (SCAAP) Program. SCAAP provides federal payments to states and localities that incurred correctional officer salary costs for incarcerating undocumented criminal aliens with at least one felony or two misdemeanor convictions for violations of state or local law, and incarcerated for at least 4 consecutive days during the reporting period.

children.name: SCAAP Annual Growth Rate (from previous year)
children.definition: Percent change in funding for the State Criminal Alien Assistance program from the previous year. SCAAP provides federal payments to states and localities that incurred correctional officer salary costs for incarcerating undocumented criminal aliens with at least one felony or two misdemeanor convictions for violations of state or local law, and incarcerated for at least 4 consecutive days during the reporting period.

children.name: County Basics
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Census Bureau, NACo Research

children.name: Census Region
children.definition: Groupings of states and the District of Columbia that subdivide the United States for the presentation of census data. There are four census regions - Northeast, Midwest, South and West.

children.name: County Seat
children.definition: Administrative center for the county.  Most counties have only one county seat. However, some counties in Alabama, Arkansas, Iowa, Kentucky, Massachusetts, Mississippi, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, and Vermont have two or more county seats, usually located on opposite sides of the county.

children.name: Year Founded
children.definition: Year the county was recognized by the state

children.name: Year Consolidated
children.definition: Year a city and a county that have been merged into one unified jurisdiction. A consolidated government has the powers and responibilities of both types of entities.

children.name: Board Size
children.definition: Nubmer of representatives elected to the county board

children.name: County Square Mileage
children.definition: Total land square miles within the county's geographical boundaries

children.name: State Capitol
children.definition: The city within the county where the state capital is located.  This field is left blank for counties that do not include the state capital.

children.name: CBSA Title
children.definition: The title of the Core Based Statistical Area the county is located in.

children.name: CBSA Code
children.definition: The Core Based Statistical Area code for the county. A 5 digit numeric code that is assigned alphabetically based on title and is unique within the nation.

children.name: Land & Water Area
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Census Bureau - Gazetteer, NACo Research - Counties with NOAA Trust Resources

children.name: Total Square Miles
children.definition: Total square miles within the county's geographical boundaries

children.name: Total Land Square Miles
children.definition: Total land square miles within the county's geographical boundaries

children.name: Total Water Square Miles
children.definition: Total square miles within the county's geographical boundaries made up of waterways.

children.name: Coastal Status
children.definition: Indicates whether a county is considered coastal. A county is considered coastal if it meets one of the following two criteria: 1) least 15 percent of its total land area is located within the nation's coastal watershed or 2) a portion of the entire county accounts for at least 15 percent of a coastal cataloging unit (an individual drainage basin).

children.name: Body of Water
children.definition: The body of water in the county into which tributaries feed (e.g. a river leads into the Atlantic Ocean so the Atlantic Ocean is listed)

children.name: Metro-Micro Areas (MSA)
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Census Bureau

children.name: CBSA Code
children.definition: The Core Based Statistical Area code for the county. A 5 digit numeric code that is assigned alphabetically based on title and is unique within the nation.

children.name: CSA Code
children.definition: The Combined Statistical Area code for the county.

children.name: CBSA Title
children.definition: The title of the Core Based Statistical Area the county is located in.

children.name: CSA Title
children.definition: The title of the Combined Statistical Area the county is located in.

children.name: Level of CBSA
children.definition: Core Based Statistical Area type as defined the Office of Management and Budget. The 2000 standards provide that each CBSA must contain at least one urban area of 10,000 or more population. Each metropolitan statistical area must have at least one urbanized area of 50,000 or more inhabitants. Each micropolitan statistical area must have at least one urban cluster of at least 10,000 but less than 50,000 population.

children.name: County Status
children.definition: Status of counties according to the Office of management and Budget. Under the standards, the county (or counties) in which at least 50 percent of the population resides within urban areas of 10,000 or more population, or that contain at least 5,000 people residing within a single urban area of 10,000 or more population, is identified as a central county. Additional outlying counties are included in the CBSA if they meet specified requirements of commuting to or from the central counties.

children.name: HIV Prevalence
children.source: NACo Analysis of National HIV Surveillance System data

children.name: HIV Prevalence Rate
children.definition: Rate of adolescents and adults aged 13 years and over (per 100,000) living with HIV.

children.name: HIV Number of Cases
children.definition: Number of individual diagnosed HIV cases within a county.

children.name: Drug Poisoning
children.source: NACo Analysis of Rossen et al, National Center for Health Statistics data
companions: Age-Adjusted Rate of Deaths Involving Heroin
Age-Adjusted Rate of Deaths Involving Opioid Analgesics
Age-Adjusted Rate of Deaths Involving Any Opioid

children.name: Drug Poisoning Death Rate
children.definition: The estimated number of deaths due to drug poisoning per 100,000 individuals.  Estimated into 5 increments.

children.name: Drug Poisoning Death Rate
children.definition: The estimated number of deaths due to drug poisoning per 100,000 individuals.

children.name: Number of Deaths Involving Heroin
children.definition: Total number of deaths involving heroin in a county, 2010-2014
children.source: Source: NACo Analysis of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Center for Health Statistics. Multiple Cause of Death 1999-2014 on CDC WONDER Online Database, released 2015

children.name: Age-Adjusted Rate of Deaths Involving Heroin
children.definition: Annual age-adjusted rate of all deaths involving heroin per 100,000 people in a county, 2010-2014
children.source: Source: NACo Analysis of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Center for Health Statistics. Multiple Cause of Death 1999-2014 on CDC WONDER Online Database, released 2015

children.name: Number of Deaths Involving Opioid Analgesics
children.definition: Total number of deaths involving opioid analgesics in a county, 2010-2014
children.source: Source: NACo Analysis of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Center for Health Statistics. Multiple Cause of Death 1999-2014 on CDC WONDER Online Database, released 2015

children.name: Age-Adjusted Rate of Deaths Involving Opioid Analgesics
children.definition: Annual age-adjusted rate of all deaths involving opioid analgesics per 100,000 people in a county, 2010-2014
children.source: Source: NACo Analysis of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Center for Health Statistics. Multiple Cause of Death 1999-2014 on CDC WONDER Online Database, released 2015

children.name: Number of Deaths Involving Any Opioid
children.definition: Total number of deaths involving any opioid in a county, 2010-2014
children.source: Source: NACo Analysis of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Center for Health Statistics. Multiple Cause of Death 1999-2014 on CDC WONDER Online Database, released 2015

children.name: Age-Adjusted Rate of Deaths Involving Any Opioid
children.definition: Annual age-adjusted rate of all deaths involving any opioid per 100,000 people in a county, 2010-2014
children.source: Source: NACo Analysis of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Center for Health Statistics. Multiple Cause of Death 1999-2014 on CDC WONDER Online Database, released 2015

children.name: Hospitals
children.source: NACo Analysis of American Hospital Directory

children.name: Number of Hospitals
children.definition: The Number of hospitals located in the county.

children.name: Number of County Supported Facilities
children.definition: The Number of hospitals supported by a county agency. Includes county, hospital district, and city-county hospitals.

children.name: Number of City Facilities
children.definition: The Number of hospitals controlled by the city in the county.

children.name: Number of County Facilities
children.definition: The Number of hospitals controlled by the county in the county.

children.name: Number of City-County Facilities
children.definition: The Number of hospitals controlled by city-county in the county.

children.name: Number of Hospital District Facilities
children.definition: The Number of hospitals controlled by hospital districts in the county.

children.name: Number of Other Government Facilities
children.definition: The Number of hospitals controlled by other governmental agencies in the county.

children.name: Number of Proprietary Facilities
children.definition: The Number of non-governmental proprietary hospitals located in the county.

children.name: Number of Nonprofit Facilities
children.definition: The Number of voluntary, non-profit hospitals located in the county.

children.name: Number of Beds
children.definition: Total number of beds available for use by patients in all hopsitals located in the county.  A bed means an adult bed, pediatric bed, birthing room, or newborn bed maintained in a patient care area for lodging patients in acute, long term, or domiciliary areas of the hospital.

children.name: Gross Revenue
children.definition: Gross revenue of all hospitals located in the county as reported on Medicare reports.

children.name: Patient Days
children.definition: Total number of patient days from most recent Medicare cost report from all hospitals located in the county.

children.name: Revenue per Bed
children.definition: Average amount of revenue per hospital bed of all hospitals located in the county.

children.name: Revenue per Patient Day
children.definition: Amount of revenue per patient day of all hospitals located in the county.

children.name: Local Health Departments
children.source: NACo Analysis of NACCHO (National Association of County and City Health Officials) data

children.name: Total Local Health Departments (LHDs)
children.definition: The total local health departments serving a county's residents, including county-supported, city, and multi-city local health departments.

children.name: County Supported Local Health Departments (LHDs)
children.definition: County, city-county and multi-county local health department(s) located within a county.  Mutiple county supported LHDs indicates that different types of county supported LHDs (county, city-county and/or multi-county) serve the population of a county.

children.name: County Supported LHD Names
children.definition: The names of all county supported local health departments located within a county, including county, city-county, and multi-county local health departments.

children.name: County LHD
children.definition: LHD primarily serves population of a county.

children.name: Multi-county LHD
children.definition: LHD primarily serves population of 2 or more counties.

children.name: City-county LHD
children.definition: LHD primarily serves population of a county and a population of a city that does not lie within the boundaries of the county it serves.

children.name: City LHD
children.definition: LHD primarily serves population of a city.

children.name: Multi-city LHD
children.definition: LHD primarily serves population of 2 or more cities.

children.name: Nursing Homes
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Department of Health & Human Services data

children.name: Number of Nursing Homes
children.definition: The number of nursing homes located in the county. A nursing home is considered a place which provides 24 hour services including board and room to 3 or more unrelated residents that require nursing care because of their mental or physical condition. Nursing homes are licensed by DHS under ch. HFS 132 Adm. Codes.

children.name: Number of County Supported Facilities
children.definition: The number of nursing homes supported by the county government. Includes county, hospital district, and city-county facilities.

children.name: Number of City Facilities
children.definition: The number of nursing homes owned by a city located in the county.

children.name: Number of County Facilities
children.definition: The number of nursing homes owned by a county government.

children.name: Number of City-County Facilities
children.definition: The number of nursing homes jointly owned by city and county governments located in the county.

children.name: Number of Hospital District Facilities
children.definition: The number of nursing homes owned by a hospital district located in the county.

children.name: Number of Other Government Facilities
children.definition: The number of nursing homes owned by a federal or state agency located in the county.

children.name: Number of For-Profit Facilities
children.definition: The number of nursing homes owned by a for-profit agency located in the county, including corporations, individuals, partnerships or limited liability companies.

children.name: Number of Nonprofit Facilities
children.definition: The number of nursing homes owned by a non-profit agency located in the county, including corporations, churches, or other agencies.

children.name: Number of Certified Beds
children.definition: The number of Medicare and/or Medicaid beds in all the nursing home facilities in the county.

children.name: Number of Residents
children.definition: The number of residents in all the nursing home facilities in the county.

children.name: Percent of Occupied Beds
children.definition: The percentage of occupied beds in all the nursing home facilities located in the county, expressed as number of residents relative to number of certified beds.

children.name: Number of Continuing Care Retirement Facilities
children.definition: The number of facilities designated as a 'continuing care retirement facility' located in the county. A continuing care facility has flexible accommodations designed to meet residents changing needs over time.

children.name: Number of Special Focus Facilities
children.definition: The number of facilities designated as having a specific focus located in the county. Special focus facilities are  nursing homes with a record of poor survey (inspection) performance on which the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services focuses extra attention.
