children.unit: days reported on avg. in the past 30 days
children.definition: Average number of physically unhealthy days reported in past 30 days (age-adjusted). For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Mentally Unhealthy Days
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System 2014 data
children.unit: days reported on avg. in the past 30 days
children.definition: Average number of mentally unhealthy days reported in past 30 days (age-adjusted). For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Low Birthweight Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of National Center for Health Statistics - Natality files 2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of live births with low birthweight (< 2500 grams). For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: County Health Rankings: Health Behaviors
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute and the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation

children.name: Smoking Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System 2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of adults who are current smokers. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Obesity Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of CDC Diabetes Interactive Atlas 2012 data
children.definition: Percentage of adults that report a BMI of 30 or more. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Food Environment Index
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of USDA Food Environment Atlas, Map the Meal Gap 2013 data
children.definition: Index of factors that contribute to a healthy food environment, 0 (worst) to 10 (best). For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Percent Physically Inactive
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of CDC Diabetes Interactive Atlas 2012 data
children.definition: Percentage of adults aged 20 and over reporting no leisure-time physical activity. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Percent with Access to Exercise
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Business Analyst, Delorme map data, ESRI, & US Census Tigerline Files 2010 & 2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of population with adequate access to locations for physical activity. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Excessive Drinking Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System 2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of adults reporting binge or heavy drinking. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Alcohol-related Share of Driving Deaths
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Fatality Analysis Reporting System 2014-2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of driving deaths with alcohol involvement. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Chlamydia Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention 2013 data
children.definition: Number of newly diagnosed chlamydia cases per 100,000 population. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Teen Birth Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of National Center for Health Statistics - Natality files 2007-2012 data
children.definition: Teen birth rate per 1,000 female population, ages 15-19. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: County Health Rankings: Clinical Care
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute and the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation

children.name: Percent Uninsured
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Small Area Health Insurance Estimates 2013 data
children.definition: Percentage of population under age 65 without health insurance. For more on methodology, click here

children.name: Primary Care Physician Ratio
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Area Health Resource File/American Medical Association 2013 data
children.definition: Ratio of population to primary care physicians. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Dentist Ratio
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Area Health Resource File/National Provider Identification file 2014 data
children.definition: Ratio of population to dentists. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Mental Health Provider Ratio
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of CMS, National Provider Identification file 2015 data
children.definition: Ratio of population to mental health providers. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Preventable Hospital Stays Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Dartmouth Atlas of Health Care 2013 data
children.definition: Number of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 1,000 Medicare enrollees. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Diabetic Monitoring Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Dartmouth Atlas of Health Care 2013 data
children.definition: Percentage of diabetic Medicare enrollees ages 65-75 that receive HbA1c monitoring. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Mammography Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Dartmouth Atlas of Health Care 2013 data
children.definition: Percentage of female Medicare enrollees ages 67-69 that receive mammography screening. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: County Health Rankings: Social & Economic Environment
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute and the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation

children.name: High School Graduation Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of data.gov, supplemented w/ National Center for Education Statistics 2012-2013 data
children.definition: Percentage of ninth-grade cohort that graduates in four years. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Percent with Some College
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of American Community Survey 2010-2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of adults ages 25-44 years with some post-secondary education. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Percent Unemployed
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Bureau of Labor Statistics 2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of population ages 16 and older unemployed but seeking work. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Child Poverty Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates 2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of children under age 18 in poverty. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Income Inequality Ratio
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of American Community Survey 2010-2014 data
children.definition: Ratio of household income at the 80th percentile to income at the 20th percentile. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Percent Single Parent Household
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of American Community Survey 2010-2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of children that live in a household headed by single parent. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Social Association Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of County Business Patterns 2013 data
children.definition: Number of membership associations per 10,000 population. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Violent Crime Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Uniform Crime Reporting - FBI 2010-2012 data
children.definition: Number of reported violent crime offenses per 100,000 population. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Injury Death Rate
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of CDC WONDER mortality 2009-2013 data
children.definition: Number of deaths due to injury per 100,000 population. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: County Health Rankings: Physical Environment
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute and the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation

children.name: Air Pollution
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of CDC WONDER Environmental 2011 data
children.definition: Average daily density of fine particulate matter in micrograms per cubic meter (PM2.5). For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Drinking Water Violations
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Safe Drinking Water Information System FY2013-14 data
children.definition: Percentage of population potentially exposed to water exceeding a violation limit during the past year. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Percent with Severe Housing Problems
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of Comprehensive Housing Affordability Strategy (CHAS) data 2008-2012 data
children.definition: Percentage of households with at least 1 of 4 housing problems: overcrowding, high housing costs, or lack of kitchen or plumbing facilities. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Percent Driving Alone to Work
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of American Community Survey 2010-2014 data
children.definition: Percentage of the workforce that drives alone to work. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Percent with Long Commutes Alone to Work
children.source: University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute analysis of American Community Survey 2010-2014 data
children.definition: Among workers who commute in their car alone, the percentage that commute more than 30 minutes. For more on methodology, click here.

children.name: Housing Units
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Census Bureau - American Community Survey (ACS) 5 year estimates

children.name: Population in Households
children.definition: Number of county residents one year or older living in households within the county.

children.name: Same House as 1 Year Ago
children.definition: Number of county residents one year or older living in households in the same house as one year ago.

children.name: Percent In Same House as 1 Year Ago
children.definition: Share of county residents one year or older living in households in the same house as one year ago.

children.name: Moved Within Same County
children.definition: Number of county residents one year or older living in households that moved within the same county in the past year.

children.name: Percent Moved Within Same County
children.definition: Share of county residents one year or older living in households that moved within the same county in the past year.

children.name: Moved From Outside the County
children.definition: Number of county residents one year or older living in households that moved from outside the county in the past year.

children.name: Percent Moved From Outside the County
children.definition: Share of county residents one year or older living in households that moved from outside the county in the past year.

children.name: Number of Housing Units
children.definition: The number of housing units located in the county. A housing unit may be a house, an apartment, a mobile home, a group of rooms or a single room that is occupied (or, if vacant, intended for occupancy) as separate living quarters.

children.name: Average Household Size
children.definition: The average number of people occupying a single housing unit in a county. This includes the householder, occupants related to the householder, lodgers, roomers, boarders.

children.name: Occupied Housing Units
children.definition: The number of occupied housing units located in the county. A housing unit is classified as occupied if it is the current place of residence of the person or group of people living in it at the time of interview, or if the occupants are only temporarily absent from the residence for two months or less, that is, away on vacation or a business trip.

children.name: Owner-Occupied Housing Units
children.definition: The number of owner-occupied housing units located in the county. A housing unit is owner-occupied if the owner or co-owner lives in the unit.

children.name: Percent of Owner-Occupied Housing Units
children.definition: The share of owner-occupied housing units out of the all the housing units located in a county. A housing unit is owner-occupied if the owner or co-owner lives in the unit.

children.name: Renter-Occupied Housing Units
children.definition: The number of renter-occupied housing units located in the county. All occupied housing units which are not owner-occupied, whether they are rented or occupied without payment of rent.

children.name: Percent of Renter-Occupied Housing Units
children.definition: The percentage of renter-occupied housing units located in the county. All occupied housing units which are not owner-occupied, whether they are rented or occupied without payment of rent.

children.name: Median Home Value
children.definition: The median estimate of how much owner-occupied houses in a county would sell for if they were for sale. These data exclude mobile homes, houses with a business or medical office, houses on 10 or more acres, and housing units in multi-unit structures.

children.name: Median Gross Rent
children.definition: The median estimate of gross rent payments in a county. Gross rent is the contract rent plus the estimated average monthly cost of utilities (electricity, gas, and water and sewer) and fuels (oil, coal, kerosene, wood, etc.) if these are paid by the renter (or paid for the renter by someone else).

children.name: Drug-related Offenses
children.source: Naco analysus of 2014 Uniform Crime Reporting Program National Incident-Based Reporting System data, Federal Bureau of Investigatino, 2016

children.name: Total Offenses
children.definition: Total nubmer of offenses for a county in 2014.

children.name: Total Drug Violations
children.definition: Total nubmerdrug and narcotic violations (e.g., possesion or distribution) for a county in 2014.

children.name: Total Drug Equipment Violations
children.definition: Total number of drug equipment violations for a county in 2014.

children.name: Total Drug-Related Offenses
children.definition: Total number of all drug-related violations for a county in 2014.

children.name: Total Heroin-Involved Offenses
children.definition: Total number of offenses in a county that involved heroin in 2014.

children.name: Total Morphine-Involved Offenses
children.definition: Total number of offenses in a county that involved morphine in 2014.

children.name: Total Opium-Involved Offenses
children.definition: Total number of offenses in a county that involved opium in 2014.

children.name: Total Prescription Opioid-Involved Offenses
children.definition: Total number of offenses in a county that involved codeine, demeral, dihydromorphinone, hydrocodone or methadone in 2014.

children.name: Percent Drug-Related Offenses
children.definition: Percent of all offenses in a county that were drug-related in 2014.

children.name: Percent Prescription
children.definition: Percent of all opioid-related offenses involving prescription opioids in a county in 2014.

children.name: Jails - Supervised Population
children.source: 2016 NACo analysis of Department of Justice Bureau of Justice Statistics, Census of Jails data

children.name: Total Jail Population
children.definition: Total number of persons supervised by the county, including persons confined in a jail facility and not confined (e.g., persons in community based supervision programs run by the jail).

children.name: Rated Jail Capacity
children.definition: The maximum number of beds or inmates assigned to the county's jail facilities by a rating official.

children.name: Jail Capacity Percent
children.definition: The percent of rated capacity occupied by inmates based on the average daily population of the county's jail facilities. This is calculated by dividing the average daily population by rated capacity and multiplying by 100.

children.name: Confined Persons
children.definition: Number of individuals confined in the county's jail facilities, including individuals in community programs who return to the jail at night, on December 31, 2013.

children.name: Nonconfined Persons
children.definition: Number of persons supervised outside of the county’s jail facilities, including in community based supervision programs such as electronic monitoring, house arrest, community service programs, day reporting and work programs.

children.name: Non US Citizens
children.definition: The number of confined persons in the county’s jail facilities that do not hold U.S. citizenship.

children.name: Weekenders
children.definition: The number of convicted persons that are released from confinement on weekdays and return to the jail on the weekend to serve their sentence.

children.name: Supervised Weekender Program
children.definition: Indicates whether the county jail has a weekender program, where convicted persons are released from confinement on weekdays and return to the jail on the weekend to serve their sentence.

children.name: Average Daily Population
children.definition: The average daily population of the county's jail facilities for January 1, 2013 to December 31, 2013.

children.name: At or Over Capacity
children.definition: Indicates whether the county's jail facilities are at or above 100 percent of capacity. Yes indicates that the county's jail facilities are at or above capacity. No indicates the county's jail facilities are below capacity.

children.name: Jails - Supervised Population by Agency
children.source: NACo Analysis of Bureau of Justice Statistics - Annual Survey of Jails
companions: Held for Local Jurisdiction in State
Held for Local Jurisdiction outside the State

children.name: Total Jail Population
children.definition: Total inmate population incarcerated or all persons in community-based programs run by jails (e.g., electronic monitoring, house arrest, community service, day reporting, and work programs).

children.name: Jail Capacity
children.definition: Maximum number of beds or inmates allocated to all jail facilities in the county

children.name: Held for US Marshals Service
children.definition: Number of inmates held in county jail facilities for the U.S. Marshals Service.

children.name: Held for Federal Bureau of Prisons
children.definition: Number of inmates held in county jail facilities for the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

children.name: Held for Immigration & Customs
children.definition: Number of inmates held in county jail facilities for U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

children.name: Held for Bureau of Indian Affairs
children.definition: Number of inmates held in county jail facilities for the Bureau of Indian Affairs.

children.name: Held for Other Federal Authorities
children.definition: Number of inmates held in county jail facilities for other federal authorities not listed.

children.name: Held for Own State
children.definition: Number of inmates held in county jail facilities for the state in which the county is located.

children.name: Held for Other State
children.definition: Number of inmates held in the county jail facilities for a state other than the one in which the county is located.

children.name: Held for Local Jurisdiction in State
children.definition: Number of inmates held in county jail facilities for another local jurisdiction in the state in which the county is located.

children.name: Held for Local Jurisdiction outside the State
children.definition: Number of inmates held in the county jail facilities for a local jail jurisdictions in a state other than the one in which the county is located.

children.name: Jails - Inmate Demographics
children.source: NACo Analysis of Bureau of Justice Statistics - Annual Survey of Jails

children.name: Adult Males
children.definition: The number of males age 18 or older in the county's jail facilities.

children.name: Adult Females
children.definition: The number of females age 18 or older in the county's jail facilities.

children.name: Total Juveniles
children.definition: The number of persons, under the age of 18, in the county's jail facilities.

children.name: Total Convicted
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are convicted.

children.name: Total Unconvicted
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are unconvicted.

children.name: White
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are White and not of Hispanic origin.

children.name: Black or African American
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are Black or African American and not of Hispanic origin.

children.name: Hispanic or Latino
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are Hispanic or Latino.

children.name: Asian
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are Asian and not of Hispanic origin.

children.name: American Indian or Alaskan Native
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are American Indian or Alaskan Native and not of Hispanic origin.

children.name: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander and not of Hispanic origin.

children.name: Two or More Races
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are two or more races and not of Hispanic origin.

children.name: Other Inmate Races
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities that are other races identified by the county jail's information system.

children.name: Race Not Known
children.definition: The number of inmates in the county's jail facilities where their race is not known.

children.name: Jails - Community Supervision
children.source: NACo Analysis of Bureau of Justice Statistics - Annual Survey of Jails

children.name: Total Jail Population
children.definition: Total inmate population incarcerated or all persons in community-based programs run by jails (e.g., electronic monitoring, house arrest, community service, day reporting, and work programs).

children.name: Jail Capacity
children.definition: Maximum number of beds or inmates allocated to all jail facilities in the county

children.name: Confined Persons
children.definition: Total number of persons housed in jail or persons in community-based programs in the county (e.g. work release, day release, drug/alcohol treatment) who return to jail at night.

children.name: Nonconfined Persons
children.definition: All persons in community-based programs run by jails in the county (e.g., electronic monitoring, house arrest, community service, day reporting, and work programs) but are not housed in the jail.

children.name: Electronic Monitoring Program
children.definition: Number of persons under the county jail's supervision that participate in a community based electronic monitoring program.

children.name: Home Detention
children.definition: Number of persons under the county jail's supervision that participate in a community based home detention program.

children.name: Community Service
children.definition: Number of persons under the county jail's supervision that participate in a community based community service program.

children.name: Day Reporting
children.definition: Number of persons under the county jail's supervision that participate in a community based day reporting program.

children.name: Other Pretrial Supervision
children.definition: Number of persons under the county jail's supervision that participate in other community based pretrial supervision programs.

children.name: Other Alternative Work Programs
children.definition: Number of persons under the county jail's supervision that participate in other community based alternative work programs.

children.name: Alcohol/Drug Treatment Programs
children.definition: Number of persons under the county jail's supervision that participate in community based alcohol or drug treatment programs.

children.name: Other Nonconfined Programs
children.definition: Number of persons under the county jail's supervision that participate in other programs outside of the county's jail facilities.

children.name: County Jails
children.source: NACo analysis of Department of Justice Bureau of Justice Statistics, Census of Jails, 2013 data

children.name: Role in Jail Operations
children.definition: Counties are classified into one of three categories to indicate its role in jail operations: Single County, Regional Partner and Combined with State.  Single County indicates the county operates the jail that serves the county.  Regional Partner indicates the county is a partner in the operations of a regional jail that serves two or more jurisdictions.  Combined with State indicates the county does not operate a jail because the state operates a corrections system that unifies county jails and prisons.

children.name: Single County Jail
children.definition: Indicates whether the county operates a jail serving the county.

children.name: Site of Regional Jail
children.definition: Indicates whether the county is the site of a regional jail operation.

children.name: Regional Jail Partner
children.definition: Indicates whether the county is a partner in a regional jail operation.

children.name: Combined with State
children.definition: Indicates whether the county is in a state where the state operates a unified jail and prison system.

children.name: Public Safety Structure
children.source: NACo Research

children.name: Elected Sheriff
children.definition: Indicates whether the county has a sheriff that is elected by county constituents

children.name: County Funded Sheriff Department
children.definition: Indicates whether funding for the Sheriff Department's general operations, administrative operations, personnel, field services and any other operating expenses is budgeted by the county

children.name: County Operated Sheriff Department
children.definition: Indicates whether the general operations, functions and responsibilities of the sheriff's office is controlled by the county

children.name: Elected Police Chief
children.definition: Indicates whether the county has a county police department with a Chief of Police in charge of oversight of the department's operations, budget and officers that is elected by county constituents

children.name: County Funded Police Department
children.definition: Indicates whether funding for the police deparment's general operations, administrative operations, personnel, field services, and any other responsibilities of the office is budgeted by the county

children.name: County Operated Police Department
children.definition: Indicates whether the general operations, functions and responsibilities of the police department is controlled by the county

children.name: County Funded Jails
children.definition: Indicates whether the funding for construction, operation and maintenance of the facility serving the county comes from that county’s budget. The county’s funds may come from taxes collected, fees incurred for various services, including the housing of state, federal or other county’s inmates, commissary sales, and any number of other fees for services.

children.name: County Funded Courts - Salaries
children.definition: Indicates whether the county funds the judicial salaries, including clerks of court, trail court administrators, court reporters and other court personnel

children.name: County Funded Courts - Buildings/Real Property
children.definition: Indicates whether the county funds the construction, operating costs and maintenance of the building and property for the court's use.

children.name: County Funded Courts - General Operating Expenses
children.definition: Indicates whether the county provides funding for general operating expenses of the trial courts

children.name: County Operated Courts
children.definition: Indicates whether the county manages the daily functions and operations of the court and oversees the daily operations of the court administration, processing and judicial functions.

children.name: Elected Judges
children.definition: Indicates whether the trial court judges for the county level court(s) is elected in an election by county constituents.  Elected judges are often elected to serve a specific term; this does not include the selection process to fill vacancies of judges who do not serve their full term.  Judges can also be appointed by a governing board or authority including a merit committee or judicial nominating commission.

children.name: Elected Clerks of Court
children.definition: Indicates whether the clerk of court, who primarily serves as the official record keeper for the courts, is elected as a county position. The responsibilities of the clerk of court vary by state or county statute, but can include maintaining and archiving the records of the court such as marriage licenses, mortgage records and birth certificates. The clerk of court is also be responsible for caseflow management, administering oaths, collecting fines and fees, and jury selection.

children.name: Elected District Attorney
children.definition: Indicates whether the official charged with representing the county government in the prosecution of criminal offenses is elected by county constituents. The position can be called many things, including district attorney, county attorney, and county prosecutor. In some states, this responsibility is taken care of on the state level, so there is no such county position.

children.name: Stepping Up For Mental Health
children.source: NACo County Solutions & Innovation as of September 19, 2016

children.name: Stepping Up Resolutions
children.definition: Stepping Up is a national initiative to reduce the number of people with mental illnesses in jails. As part of the Stepping Up Call to Action, county elected officials are being asked to pass a resolution or proclamation to participate in the initiative. The counties indicated on this map have all passed resolutions or proclamations supporting the initiative and committed to working with county and state leaders (e.g., the sheriff, judges, district attorney, treatment providers, and state and local policymakers), people with mental illnesses and their advocates, and other stakeholders to reduce the number of people with mental illnesses in jails. Find out more here. To read the latest news on counties participating in the Stepping Up Initiative click here.

children.name: Libraries
children.source: NACo Analysis of Institute of Museum and Library Services - Public Libraries Survey (PLS)
companions: Library Collections - Number of Print Materials

children.name: Number of Libraries
children.definition: Total number of libraries within the county.

children.name: County Supported Libraries
children.definition: Number of libraries reported as being operated by a county government, library district or jointly by two or more units of local government.

children.name: Number of Central Service Outlets
children.definition: Number of central libraries, which are one type of single outlet library (SO) or the library, which is the operational center of a multiple-outlet library (MO or MA). Usually all processing is centralized here and the principal collections are housed here. Synonymous with main library.

children.name: Number of Branches
children.definition: Number of branch libraries which are an auxiliary unit of an administrative entity which has at least all of the following:  Separate quarters; An organized collection of library materials; Paid staff; and Regularly scheduled hours for being open to the public.

children.name: Number of Bookmobiles
children.definition: Number of bookmobiles in the county. A bookmobile is a traveling branch library. It consists of at least one of the following: A truck or van that carries an organized collection of library materials; paid staff; and regularly scheduled hours (bookmobile stops) for being open to the public.

children.name: Population of Local Service Area
children.definition: The total number of estimated number of residents in the local service area in all central service outlets in the county

children.name: Full Time Librarians
children.definition: Number of Full Time Equivalent of librarians. Persons with the title of librarian do paid work that usually requires professional training and skill in the theoretical or scientific aspects of library work, or both, as distinct from its mechanical or clerical aspect.

children.name: Total FTE Staff
children.definition: Number of Full Time Equivalent of librarians and other paid staff

children.name: Annual Hours - All Outlets
children.definition: The sum of the annual public service hours for all outlets

children.name: Total Operating Revenue
children.definition: The sum of the Local Government Revenue, State Government Revenue, Federal Government Revenue, and Other Operating Revenue for all central service outlets in the county.

children.name: Operating Revenue from Local Government
children.definition: All local government funds designated by the community, district, or region and available for expenditure by the public library. Do not include the value of any contributed or in-kind services or the value of any gifts and donations, library fines, fees, or grants. Does not include state, federal, and other funds passed through local government for library use. These funds are included with state government revenue or federal government revenue, as appropriate.

children.name: Operating Revenue from State Government
children.definition: All funds distributed to public libraries by state government for expenditure by the public libraries, except for federal money distributed by the state. This includes funds from such sources as penal fines, license fees, and mineral rights. Note: If operating revenue from consolidated taxes is the result of state legislation, the revenue is reported under state revenue (even though the revenue may be from multiple sources).

children.name: Operating Revenue from Federal Government
children.definition: All federal government funds distributed to public libraries for expenditure by the public libraries, including federal money distributed by the state.

children.name: Other Operating Revenue
children.definition: All operating revenue other than that reported under local, state, and federal. For example, this includes monetary gifts and donations received in the current year, interest, library fines, fees for library services, or grants. It does not include the value of any contributed or in-kind services or the value of any non-monetary gifts and donations.

children.name: Operating Expenditures Salaries and Benefits
children.definition: Salaries and wages for all library staff (including plant operations, security, and maintenance staff) for the fiscal year. Includes salaries and wages before deductions.  Also includes employee benefits outside of salaries and wages paid and accruing to employees regardless of whether the benefits or equivalent cash options are available to all employees. Includes amounts for direct paid employee benefits including Social Security, retirement, medical insurance, life insurance, guaranteed disability income protection, unemployment compensation, workmen’s compensation, tuition, and housing benefits.

children.name: Operating Expenditures Library Collections
children.definition: The sum of Print Materials Expenditures, Electronic Materials Expenditures, and Other Materials Expenditures.

children.name: Other Operating Expenditures
children.definition: All expenditures other than those reported for Total Staff Expenditures and Total Collection Expenditures.

children.name: Total Operating Expenditures
children.definition: The sum of Total Staff Expenditures, Total Collection Expenditures, and Other Operating Expenditures.

children.name: Total Capital Revenue
children.definition: The sum of Local Government Capital Revenue, State Government Capital Revenue, Federal Government Capital Revenue, and Other Capital Revenue.

children.name: Total Capital Expenditures
children.definition: Total major capital expenditures (the acquisition of or additions to fixed assets). Examples include expenditures for (a) site acquisitions; (b) new buildings; (c) additions to or renovation of library buildings; (d) furnishings, equipment, and initial book stock for new buildings, building additions, or building renovations; (e) library automation systems; (f) new vehicles; and (g) other one-time major projects.

children.name: Library Collections - Number of Print Materials
children.definition: Total number includes books including duplicates at all outlets and series back files in print for all outlets.

children.name: Library Collections - Number of Electronic Books
children.definition: Total number of Electronic Books (E-books) including duplicates for all outlets.  E-books are digital documents (including those digitized by the library), licensed or not, where searchable text is prevalent, and which can be seen in analogy to a printed book (monograph).

children.name: Library Collections - Number of Audio Materials
children.definition: Total number of audio materials including duplicates for all outlets. These are materials on which sounds (only) are stored (recorded) and that can be reproduced (played back) mechanically, electronically, or both. Include records, audiocassettes, audio cartridges, audio discs (including audio-CD-ROMs), audio-reels, talking books, and other sound recordings, such as web-based or downloaded audiobooks and MP3 files.

children.name: Library Collections - Number of Video Materials
children.definition: Total number of video materials including duplicates for all outlets. These are materials on which moving pictures are recorded, with or without sound. Electronic playback reproduces pictures, with or without sound, using a television receiver or monitor. Video formats may include tape, DVD, CD-ROM, web-based or downloaded files, etc.

children.name: Total Annual Visits
children.definition: The total number of persons entering the library for whatever purpose during the year.

children.name: Total Annual Circulation
children.definition: The total annual circulation of all library materials of all types, including renewals.

children.name: Number of Computers Available
children.definition: The total number of the library’s Internet computers [personal computers (PCs) and laptops], whether purchased, leased, or donated, used by the general public in the library.

children.name: Number of Computer Users
children.definition: The total number of individuals that have used Internet computers in the library during the last year. If the computer is used for multiple purposes (Internet access, word-processing, OPAC, etc.) and Internet users could not be isolated, all usage is reported.

children.name: Number of Licensed Databases
children.definition: The total number of licensed databases (including locally mounted or remote, full-text or not) for which temporary or permanent access rights have been acquired through payment by the library, or by formal agreement with the State Library or a cooperative agreement within the state or region. A database is a collection of electronically stored data or unit records (facts, bibliographic data, abstracts, texts) with a common user interface and software for the retrieval and manipulation of the data.

children.name: Registered Borrowers
children.definition: Total number of registered borrowers, who are library users who has applied for and received an identification number or card from the public library that has established conditions under which the user may borrow library materials and gain access to other library resources.

children.name: Total Programs
children.definition: Total number of programs offered by the library. A program is any planned event which introduces the group attending to any of the broad range of library services or activities or which directly provides information to participants. Programs may cover use of the library, library services, or library tours. Programs may also provide cultural, recreational, or educational information, often designed to meet a specific social need. Examples of these types of programs include film showings,  lectures, story hours, literacy, English as a second language, citizenship classes, and book discussions.  All programs, whether held on- or off-site, that are sponsored or co-sponsored by the library are included. Programs sponsored by other groups that use library facilities are excluded. If programs are offered as a series, each program in the series is counted. For example, a film series offered once a week for eight weeks is  counted as eight programs. Library activities delivered on a one-to-one basis, rather than to a group, are excluded such as one-to-one literacy tutoring, services to homebound, resume writing assistance, homework assistance, and mentoring activities.

children.name: Arts Establishments
children.source: NACo Analysis of Americans for the Arts Creative Industries data

children.name: Arts Businesses
children.definition: The number of businesses involved in the creation or distribution of the arts—ranging from nonprofit museums, symphonies, and theaters to for-profit film, architecture, and design companies.

children.name: Arts Employees
children.definition: The number of employees involved in the creation or distribution of the arts—ranging from nonprofit museums, symphonies, and theaters to for-profit film, architecture, and design companies.

children.name: Share Arts Businesses
children.definition: The share of businesses located within a county involved in the creation or distribution of the arts.

children.name: Share Arts Employees
children.definition: The share of employees located within a county that work in the creation or distribution of the arts.

children.name: Homeless Shelters
children.source: Source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development PIT data

children.name: Total Beds Available
children.definition: The total number of beds available for use by those experiencing homelessness or domestic violence.

children.name: Beds for Families with Children
children.definition: The number of beds available for use by families with at least one adult and one child.

children.name: Beds for Chronically Homeless
children.definition: The number of beds available for those who have been homeless for a year or more.

children.name: County Veterans Service Office
children.source: National Association of County Veterans Service Officers (NACVSO)

children.name: CVSO Status
children.definition: Indicates how County Veterans Services Officers (CVSO) operate within a state. 'County' refers to a county located in a state where most or all counties have CVSOs. 'Some local' refers to counties in a state where a few counties have CVSOs and/or veterans services officers are city and township-based. 'State' refers to a county located within a state where veterans services officers are regional and operate at the state-level. 'None' means there are no locally-based veterans services officers.

children.name: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Census Bureau, 2011-2015 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates; U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis Personal Current Transfer Receipts Data

children.name: SNAP Benefits
children.definition: Benefits issued to qualifying low-income  individuals in order to supplement their ability to purchase food. Eligibility is determined by the state authorities' interpretation of Federal regulations; the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) pays the cost of the assistance.

children.name: SNAP Recipient Households
children.definition: The number of households in a county receiving Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits. A SNAP recipient household has one or more of the current household members that received food stamps or a food stamp benefit card during the past 12 months

children.name: SNAP Benefits per Household
children.definition: The average amount of SNAP benefits received by the SNAP recipient households located in a county.

children.name: SNAP Benefit Growth Rate
children.definition: Growth Rate in the average amount of SNAP benefits received by the SNAP recipient households located in a county.

children.name: SNAP Recipient Growth Rate
children.definition: Growth Rate in the number of households in a county receiving Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits. A SNAP recipient household has one or more of the current household members that received food stamps or a food stamp benefit card during the past 12 months.

children.name: SNAP per Household Growth Rate
children.definition: Growth rate in the average amount of SNAP benefits received by the SNAP recipient households located in a county.

children.name: Poverty
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Census Bureau, Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates 2015; U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey 2011-2015 5-year Estimates
companions: Percent of Children in High Poverty Areas

children.name: Poverty Rate
children.definition: The percentage of people in a county living in poverty.

children.name: Number of People in Poverty
children.definition: The number of people in a county that are in poverty.

children.name: Child Poverty Rate
children.definition: The percentage of children in a county that are in poverty.

children.name: Number of Children in Poverty
children.definition: The number of children in a county that are in poverty.

children.name: Percent of Children in High Poverty Areas
children.definition: The percentage of children in a county living in high poverty areas.  The U.S. Census Bureau designates a census tract with a poverty rate of 20 percent or more as a high poverty area.

children.name: Number of Children in High Poverty Areas
children.definition: The number of children in a county living in high poverty areas.  The U.S. Census Bureau designates a census tract with a poverty rate of 20 percent or more as a high poverty area.

children.name: Household Income Place Effect
children.definition: The estimated percentage gain (or loss) effect for all children of growing up in the county on the household income in adulthood (at age 26) for a child with parents at the 25th income percentile. This effect assumes that the individual spent 20 years of her first 26 years of life in that county and the effect is relative to the national average. For more on the the methodology, click here.

children.name: State Level Transportation
children.source: June, 2015 NACo analysis of various sources

children.name: Statewide Share of County-Owned Roads
companions: Statewide County Owned Share of Structurally-Deficient Bridges
Statewide Share of County-Owned Off-System Bridges
children.source: NACo analysis of U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT), FHWA, Highway Performance Monitoring System data
children.definition: The percentage of county owned roads out of the public roads located in the state.

children.name: Statewide Share of County-Owned Bridges
companions: Statewide County Owned Share of Structurally-Deficient Bridges
Statewide Share of County-Owned Off-System Bridges
children.source: NACo analysis of U.S. DOT, FHWA, National Bridge Inventory data
children.definition: The percentage of county owned bridges out of all bridges located in the state.

children.name: Statewide County Owned Share of Structurally-Deficient Bridges
companions: Statewide County Owned Share of Structurally-Deficient Bridges
Statewide Share of County-Owned Off-System Bridges
children.source: NACo analysis of U.S. DOT, FHWA, National Bridge Inventory data
children.definition: Share of county-owned bridges out of all structurally deficient bridges in the state.

children.name: Statewide Share of County-Owned Off-System Bridges
companions: Statewide County Owned Share of Structurally-Deficient Bridges
Statewide Share of County-Owned Off-System Bridges
children.source: NACo analysis of U.S. DOT, FHWA, National Bridge Inventory data
children.definition: Share of county-owned bridges out of all statewide off system bridges.  Off-system bridges are located on a public road that is not part of the federal-aid highway system.

children.name: State Gas Tax Type
children.source: NACo analysis and update of 2011 Institute for Taxation and Economic Policy (ITEP) data
children.definition: State gas tax rates (fixed or variable), as of May 2015. Gas taxes can be imposed at a fixed rate per gallon (cents per gallon) or as a variable rate tax that is tied to inflation, often as a percentage of the price of gasoline.  Fixed rate gas taxes are not tied to inflation and are only  changed when lawmakers vote to change them.

children.name: State Gas Tax Rate
children.source: NACo Analysis of American Petroleum Institute
children.definition: State excise tax on gasoline, as of April 2015. This is a tax imposed on the sale of gasoline.

children.name: Years Since Last State Gas Tax Increase
children.source: NACo Analysis of various sources, June 2015
children.definition: Number of years since passage of legislation increasing the state gas tax, as of June 2015

children.name: State Limits on Property Tax
children.source: NACo update of National Conference of State Legislatures, A Guide to Property Taxes: Property Tax Relief, 2009; February 2014
children.definition: State imposed limitations on county property tax rates and property assessment, as of February 2014.  These limitations include property tax rate limits, assessment limits, limits on property tax revenue (levy) increases, expenditure limits, property tax freezes.

children.name: State Authorized Local Gas Tax
children.source: NACo analysis of various sources, February
children.definition: States allowing counties to collect local option gas taxes, as of February 2014. Local option gas tax is a tax collected by a local government on the sale of gasoline within their jurisdiction, if the local government is granted the authority by the state. The revenues from this tax are used for transportation purposes. Besides state authority, often the local government needs a local law or voter approval to implement the local option gas tax. To be considered a local option gas tax for these data, the state authority to collect the tax must be granted to counties; statewide and state collected gas taxes that do not require local approval are not considered local gas taxes.

children.name: Local Option Sales Tax
children.source: NACo analysis of 2001 Goldman, Corbett and Wachs data
children.definition: County local option sales taxes for transportation, as of February 2014. Local option sales tax is a tax collected by a local government on the sale of any taxable goods within its jurisdiction, if the local government is granted the authority by the state. Besides state authority, often the local government needs a local law or voter approval to implement the local option sales tax. To be considered a local option sales tax for these data, the state authority to collect the tax must be granted to counties and the tax revenue used for transportation or for general purposes, including transportation. A local option sales tax differs from a local option gas tax through the tax base; the local gas tax only applies to the sale of gasoline, whereas a local option sales tax applies to the sale of any taxable goods within the county.

children.name: Airports
children.source: NACo Analysis of Federal Aviation Administration and Office of Aviation Analysis, U.S. Department of Transportation
companions: Number of Aircraft at County Airports

children.name: Total Airports
children.definition: Total number of airports located in a county, as of January 2015.  An airport includes an appurtenant area used or intended for airport buildings, facilities, as well as rights of way together with the buildings and facilities.

children.name: Publicly Owned Airports
children.definition: Number of publicly owned airports located in a county, as of January 2015.  This category includes publicly-owned public use aiports as well as military, hospital and other publicly-owned private use airports.

children.name: Privately Owned Airports
children.definition: Number of privately owned airports located in a county, as of January 2015.

children.name: Military Owned Airports
children.definition: Number of military owned airports located in a county, including MA (U.S. Government United States Air Force), MR (U.S. Army), MN (U.S. Navy) and CG (U.S. Coast Guard), as of January 2015.

children.name: County Airports
children.definition: Number of public airports owned by counties or regional airport authorities with county ownership or county elected officials on the board of the airport authorities, as of January 2015.

children.name: Number of Aircraft at County Airports
children.definition: Total number of aircraft at all county-owned airports in a county, including Single Engine General Aviation, Multi-Engine General Aviation, Jet Engine General Aviation, and Helicopter General Aviation aircraft, as of January 2015.

children.name: General Aviation County Airports
children.definition: Number of county airports not designated by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) as commercial service airports, cargo service airports, or reliever airports that enplane more than 2500 passengers annually and receive scheduled airline service, as of January 2015.

children.name: Commercial Aviation County Airports
children.definition: Number of county airports with more than 2,500 passenger boardings each year that receive scheduled passenger service, as of January 2015. This category includes primary airports and non-primary commercial-service airports.

children.name: Primary County Airports
children.definition: Number of County-owned Primary Airports in a county, as of January 2015.  These are airports designated by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) that have more than 10,000 passenger boardings each year.

children.name: Reliever County Airports
children.definition: Number of County-owned Reliever Airports in a county, as of January 2015.  These are airports designated by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to relieve congestion at Commercial Service Airports.

children.name: All Bridges
children.source: NACo Analysis of Federal Highway Administration - National Bridge Inventory

children.name: All Bridges - Total
children.definition: Total number of bridges located in the county.

children.name: All Bridges - City/Town Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a Town or Township Highway Agency or a City or Municipal Highway Agency.

children.name: All Bridges - County Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a County Highway Agency.

children.name: All Bridges - Local Government Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a town or township highway agency, a city or municipal highwya agency, or a county highway agency.

children.name: All Bridges - Federal Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a Federal Agency. Includes the Indian Tribal Government, Bureau of Indian Affairs, Bureau of Fish and Wildlife, U.S. Forest Service, National Park Service, Tennessee Valley Authority, Bureau of Land Management, Bureau of Reclamation, Corps of Engineers (Civil), Corps of Engineers (Military), Air Force, Navy/Marines, Army, NASA, Metropolitan Washington Airports Service, GSA, Zoo/Smithsonian, NSA, Pentagon, USDA/ARS, DOE and Other Federal Agencies.

children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a Local Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency or Local Toll Authority, or Other Local Agencies.

children.definition: Share of bridges owned by a Town or Township Highway Agency or a City or Municipal Highway Agency out of the total bridges in a county.

children.name: All Bridges - Share County Owned
children.definition: Share of bridges owned by a County Highway Agency out of the total bridges in a county.

children.name: All Bridges - Share Local Government Owned
children.definition: Share of bridges owned by a town or township highway agency, a city or municipal highwya agency, or a county highway agency out of the total bridges in a county.

children.name: All Bridges - Share Federal Owned
children.definition: Share of bridges owned by a Federal Agency out of the total bridges in a county.  Includes the Indian Tribal Government, Bureau of Indian Affairs, Bureau of Fish and Wildlife, U.S. Forest Service, National Park Service, Tennessee Valley Authority, Bureau of Land Management, Bureau of Reclamation, Corps of Engineers (Civil), Corps of Engineers (Military), Air Force, Navy/Marines, Army, NASA, Metropolitan Washington Airports Service, GSA, Zoo/Smithsonian, NSA, Pentagon, USDA/ARS, DOE and Other Federal Agencies.

children.name: All Bridges - Share Privately Owned
children.definition: Share of bridges owned by a Private agency out of the total bridges in a county.

children.name: All Bridges - Share State Owned
children.definition: Share of bridges owned by a State Highway Agency, a State Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency, Other State Agencies, or State Toll Authority out of the total bridges in a county.

children.name: All Bridges - Share Local Owned
children.definition: Share of bridges owned by a Local Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency or Local Toll Authority, or Other Local Agencies out of the total bridges in a county.

children.name: Structurally Deficient Bridges
children.source: NACo Analysis of Federal Highway Administration - National Bridge Inventory

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Total
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges; A highway bridge is classified as structurally deficient if the deck, superstructure, substructure, or culvert is rated in 'poor' condition (0 to 4 on the NBI rating scale). A bridge can also be classified as structurally deficient if its load carrying capacity is significantly below current design standards or if a waterway below frequently overtops the bridge during floods.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - City/Town Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a Town or Township Highway Agency or a City or Municipal Highway Agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - County Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a County Highway Agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Local Government Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a town or township highway agency, a city or municipal highwya agency, or a county highway agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Federal Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a Federal Agency. Includes the Indian Tribal Government, Bureau of Indian Affairs, Bureau of Fish and Wildlife, U.S. Forest Service, National Park Service, Tennessee Valley Authority, Bureau of Land Management, Bureau of Reclamation, Corps of Engineers (Civil), Corps of Engineers (Military), Air Force, Navy/Marines, Army, NASA, Metropolitan Washington Airports Service, GSA, Zoo/Smithsonian, NSA, Pentagon, USDA/ARS, DOE and Other Federal Agencies.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Privately Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a Private agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - State Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a State Highway Agency, a State Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency, Other State Agencies, or State Toll Authority.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Local Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a Local Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency or Local Toll Authority, or Other Local Agencies.

children.name: Share Structurally Deficient
children.definition: Share of structurally deficient bridges out of the all bridges in a county; A highway bridge is classified as structurally deficient if the deck, superstructure, substructure, or culvert is rated in 'poor' condition (0 to 4 on the NBI rating scale). A bridge can also be classified as structurally deficient if its load carrying capacity is significantly below current design standards or if a waterway below frequently overtops the bridge during floods.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Share of City/Town Owned
children.definition: Share of structurally deficient bridges out of all those owned by a Town or Township Highway Agency or a City or Municipal Highway Agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Share of County Owned
children.definition: Share of structurally deficient bridges out of all those owned by a County Highway Agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Share of Local Government Owned
children.definition: Share of structurally deficient bridges out of all those owned by a town or township highway agency, a city or municipal highwya agency, or a county highway agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Share of Federal Owned
children.definition: Share of structurally deficient bridges out of all those owned by a Federal Agency. Includes the Indian Tribal Government, Bureau of Indian Affairs, Bureau of Fish and Wildlife, U.S. Forest Service, National Park Service, Tennessee Valley Authority, Bureau of Land Management, Bureau of Reclamation, Corps of Engineers (Civil), Corps of Engineers (Military), Air Force, Navy/Marines, Army, NASA, Metropolitan Washington Airports Service, GSA, Zoo/Smithsonian, NSA, Pentagon, USDA/ARS, DOE and Other Federal Agencies.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Share of Privately Owned
children.definition: Share of structurally deficient bridges out of all those owned by a Private agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Share of State Owned
children.definition: Share of structurally deficient bridges out of all those owned by a State Highway Agency, a State Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency, Other State Agencies, or State Toll Authority.

children.name: Structurally Deficient - Share of Local Owned
children.definition: Share of structurally deficient bridges out of all those owned by a Local Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency or Local Toll Authority, or Other Local Agencies.

children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges owned by a Private agency.

children.name: Functionally Obsolete - State Owned
children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges owned by a State Highway Agency, a State Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency, Other State Agencies, or State Toll Authority.

children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges owned by a Local Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency or Local Toll Authority, or Other Local Agencies.

children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Department of Transportation – Federal Highway Administration, Highway Performance Monitoring System

children.name: Total Public Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of public roads, which are any roads or streets owned and maintained by a public authority and open to public travel.

children.name: Interstate Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of interstate highway, defined as a divided arterial highway for through traffic with full or partial control of access and grade separations at major intersections

children.name: Other Freeway/Expressway Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of other freeway and expressway, defined as all urban principal arterials with limited access but not part of the Interstate system.

children.name: Other Principle Arterial Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of other principle arterial roads, defined as major streets or highways, many of multi-lane or freeway design, serving high-volume traffic corridor movements that connect major generators of travel.

children.name: Minor Arterial Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of minor arterial roads, defined as roads linking cities and larger towns in rural areas. In urban areas, roads that link but do not penetrate neighborhoods within a community.

children.name: Major Collector Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of major collector roads, defined as routes that serve intracounty rather than statewide travel.

children.name: Urban Minor Collector Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of urban minor collector roads, defined as streets that provide direct access to neighborhoods and arterials.

children.name: Local Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of local roads, defined as roads intended solely for access to adjacent properties.

children.name: Share Interstate
children.definition: Percentage of interstate road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Other Freeway/Expressway
children.definition: Percentage of other freeway and expressway road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Other Principle Arterial
children.definition: Percentage of other principle arterial road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Minor Arterial
children.definition: Percentage of minor arterial road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Major Collector
children.definition: Percentage of major collector road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Urban Minor Collector
children.definition: Percentage of urban minor collector road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Local
children.definition: Percentage of local road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Road Ownership
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Department of Transportation – Federal Highway Administration, Highway Performance Monitoring System

children.name: Total Public Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of public roads, which are any roads or streets owned and maintained by a public authority and open to public travel.

children.name: State Highway Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles that are under the control of a state highway agency.

children.name: County Highway Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of the county plus city or municipality for consolidated governments.

children.name: Other State Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of another state agency.

children.name: Other Local Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of another local agency.

children.name: Privately Owned Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of private agency.

children.name: Town or Township Highway Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of a town or township highway agency.

children.name: City or Municipal Highway Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of a municipal highway agency.

children.name: Other Public Instrumentality Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of other public instrumentality.

children.name: Indian Tribe/Nation Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of Indian Tribe/Nation/Government.

children.name: Federal Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of a federal agency.

children.name: County Land Square Miles
children.definition: Total land area within the county’s geographical boundaries.

children.name: Total Road Miles per Square Mile
children.definition: Total public road miles per square mile of county land area.

children.name: Total County Road Miles per Square Mile
children.definition: Total public road miles under the control of the county plus city or municipality for consolidated governments per square mile of the county land area.

children.name: Unknown Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of any other agency.

children.name: Share State Highway Agency
children.definition: Percentage public road miles that are under the control of a state highway agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share County Highway Agency
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of the county plus city or municipality for consolidated governments out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Other State Agencies
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of another state agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Other Local Agencies
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of another local agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Private
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of private agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Town or Township Highway Agency
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of a town or township highway agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share City or Municipal Highway Agency
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of a municipal highway agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Other Public Instrumentality
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of other public instrumentality out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Indian Tribe/Nation
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of Indian Tribe/Nation/Government out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Federal Agency
children.definition: Percentage Public road miles under the control of a federal agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Unknown
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of any other agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Broadband Connections
children.source: NACo Analysis of Federal Communications Commission

children.name: Fixed Internet Connections
children.definition: Number of residential fixed connections over 200 kbps in at least one direction in the county per 1000 households.

children.name: Fixed Internet Providers
children.definition: Number of providers of residential fixed connections over 200 kbps in at least one direction available in the county.

children.name: Mobile Internet Providers
children.definition: Number of providers of mobile connections available in the county. Wireless ISPs report in the mobile wireless category if providing a commercial service that can be received at any location within a service footprint. Wireless local area networks (such as Wi-Fi hotspots) that only enable local distribution and sharing of a premises connection are not included, although the shared premises connection is included.

children.name: MFA Profiles
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Census Bureau, U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis, Federal Communications Commission, University of Tennessee data
companions: Statewide MFA Uncollected Revenue Growth Rate

children.name: MFA Profiles
children.definition: Profiles showing the uncollected MFA revenue and forgone ITFA revenue by state and local governments.

children.name: Statewide MFA Uncollected Revenue
children.definition: The estimated 2013 uncollected revenue by states and local governments of existing sales and use taxes on remote sales.

children.name: Statewide MFA Uncollected Revenue Growth Rate
children.definition: 2011-2013 Percent change in the estimated uncollected revenue by states and local governments of existing sales and use taxes on remote sales between 2011 and 2013

children.name: Statewide ITFA Forgone Revenue
children.definition: The estimated revenue that would have been collected, had the Internet Tax Freedom Act's provision preventing the taxation of broadband access not been in place.

children.name: Statewide ITFA Forgone Revenue Growth Rate
children.definition: The growth rate from 2011 to 2013 in the estimated revenue that would have been collected, had the Internet Tax Freedom Act's provision preventing the taxation of broadband access not been in place.

children.name: Transportation Funding Profiles
children.source: NACo Analysis of U.S. Department of Transportation – Federal Highway Administration, Highway Performance Monitoring System data

children.name: Transportation Funding Profiles
children.definition: Profiles on state level transportation funding and financing for counties.
companions: Statewide County Owned Share of Structurally-Deficient Bridges

children.name: MAP-21 Profiles
children.source: NACo 2014 Analysis of MAP-21 funding, Federal Highway Administration - Highway Performance Monitoring System 2011 data and National Bridge Inventory data

Statewide Share of Locally Owned Structurally Deficient Bridges
Statewide Share of Locally Owned Federal-Aid Highway Miles
Statewide Share of Locally Owned Road Miles
Statewide Share of Locally Owned Bridges
Statewide Share of Locally Owned Structurally Deficient Bridges

children.name: MAP-21 Profiles
children.source: NACo Analysis of MAP-21 funding, Federal Highway Administration - Highway Performance Monitoring System 2011 data and National Bridge Inventory data 2013
children.definition: State level profiles showing the funding decrease under MAP-21 for locally owned federal-aid highways and bridges and the role of local government ownership in the state bridge inventory and federal-aid highway system.

children.name: Statewide Share of Locally Owned Federal-Aid Highway Miles
children.definition: The 2011 share of locally owned federal-aid highway miles out of all the federal-aid highway miles in the state.

children.name: Statewide Share of Locally Owned Road Miles
children.definition: The 2011 share of locally owned road miles out of all the road miles in the state.

children.name: Statewide Share of Locally Owned Bridges
children.definition: The 2013 share of locally owned bridges out of the statewide bridge inventory.

children.name: Statewide Share of Locally Owned Structurally Deficient Bridges
children.definition: The 2013 share of locally owned structurally deficient bridges out of the structurally-deficient bridge inventory statewide.

children.name: Funding Percent Change for Local Gov Under MAP-21
children.definition: The decrease in funding available for locally owned bridges and federal-aid highways under MAP-21.
